nvt4j
Interface Terminal

public interface Terminal

This interface is used by the application to read characters from- and to send characters to, the terminal emulator.

Method Summary
 void clear()
          Clears the screen.
 void close()
          Closes the terminal.
 void flush()
          Sends all characters in the buffer (if any) to the terminal.
 int get()
          Returns the next character sent by the terminal, or -1 if the stream is closed.
 int get(byte[] buf)
          Reads some characters from the terminal and writes them to buffer 'buf' starting from position 0, and returns the number of characters read, or -1 if the stream is closed.
 int get(byte[] buf, int off, int len)
          Reads up to 'len' characters from the terminal and writes them to buffer 'buf' starting from position 'off', and returns the number of characters read, or -1 if the stream is closed.
 int getColumns()
          Returns the number of columns in the terminal emulator window.
 int getRows()
          Returns the number of rows in the terminal emulator window.
 void move(int row, int column)
          Sends the terminal emulator a command to move the cursor to the given row and column.
 void put(byte c)
          Writes one character to the terminal.
 void put(byte[] buf)
          Writes buffer 'buf' to the terminal.
 void put(byte[] buf, int off, int len)
          Writes 'len' characters to the terminal, starting from position 'off'.
 void put(char c)
          Writes one character to the terminal.
 void put(int c)
          Writes one character to the terminal.
 void put(int row, int column, byte c)
          Moves the cursor and writes one character to the terminal.
 void put(int row, int column, byte[] buf)
          Moves the cursor and writes buffer 'buf' to the terminal.
 void put(int row, int column, byte[] buf, int off, int len)
          Moves the cursor and writes 'len' characters to the terminal, starting from position 'off'.
 void put(int row, int column, char c)
          Moves the cursor and writes one character to the terminal.
 void put(int row, int column, int c)
          Moves the cursor and writes one character to the terminal.
 void put(int row, int column, java.lang.String s)
          Moves the cursor and writes a string to the terminal.
 void put(java.lang.String s)
          Writes a string to the terminal.
 void setCursor(boolean on)
          Turns the terminal emulator's cursor on or off.
 

Method Detail

setCursor

void setCursor(boolean on)
               throws java.io.IOException
Turns the terminal emulator's cursor on or off.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

clear

void clear()
           throws java.io.IOException
Clears the screen.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getRows

int getRows()
Returns the number of rows in the terminal emulator window. If the window is resized this value is updated accordingly.

getColumns

int getColumns()
Returns the number of columns in the terminal emulator window. If the window is resized this value is updated accordingly.

get

int get()
        throws java.io.IOException
Returns the next character sent by the terminal, or -1 if the stream is closed. The terminal is in 'raw' mode, not line-buffered mode. This method blocks until a character is available.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

get

int get(byte[] buf)
        throws java.io.IOException
Reads some characters from the terminal and writes them to buffer 'buf' starting from position 0, and returns the number of characters read, or -1 if the stream is closed. This method blocks until a character is available. The terminal is in 'raw' mode, not line-buffered mode.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

get

int get(byte[] buf,
        int off,
        int len)
        throws java.io.IOException
Reads up to 'len' characters from the terminal and writes them to buffer 'buf' starting from position 'off', and returns the number of characters read, or -1 if the stream is closed. This method blocks until a character is available. The terminal is in 'raw' mode, not line-buffered mode.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

put

void put(byte[] buf,
         int off,
         int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
Writes 'len' characters to the terminal, starting from position 'off'.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

put

void put(byte[] buf)
         throws java.io.IOException
Writes buffer 'buf' to the terminal.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

put

void put(java.lang.String s)
         throws java.io.IOException
Writes a string to the terminal. The characters are extracted from the string using the method String.getBytes(), which translates each (2-byte) unicode character to a byte.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the end of string would be outside the window
java.io.IOException

put

void put(int c)
         throws java.io.IOException
Writes one character to the terminal. The int is converted into a byte by casting.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

put

void put(char c)
         throws java.io.IOException
Writes one character to the terminal. The char is converted into a byte by casting.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

put

void put(byte c)
         throws java.io.IOException
Writes one character to the terminal.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

         int column,
         byte[] buf,
         int off,
         int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
Moves the cursor and writes 'len' characters to the terminal, starting from position 'off'.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of range
java.io.IOException

         int column,
         byte[] buf)

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of range
java.io.IOException

put

void put(int row,
         int column,
         java.lang.String s)
         throws java.io.IOException
Moves the cursor and writes a string to the terminal. The characters are extracted from the string using the method String.getBytes(), which translates each (2-byte) unicode character to a byte.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of range
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the end of string would be outside the window
java.io.IOException

flush

void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
Sends all characters in the buffer (if any) to the terminal.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

move

void move(int row,
          int column)
          throws java.io.IOException
Sends the terminal emulator a command to move the cursor to the given row and column. The row must be between 1 and the value of getRows(), while the column must be between 1 and the value of getColumn().

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of range
java.io.IOException

close

void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the terminal.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
